unnormalised: ## Basket Bhool Gaye? Why Customers Are Leaving Your Online Shopping Cart Like a Dabba at Churchgate Station!
normalised: Basket Bhool Gaye? Why Customers Are Leaving Your Online Shopping Cart Like a Dabba at Churchgate Station!

unnormalised: So, you’ve finally done it. You've built the perfect e-commerce website. Your product photos are sharper than Ranveer Singh's eyeliner, your descriptions are wittier than a Kapil Sharma punchline, and your prices… well, they’re competitive enough to make your neighbour Sharma uncle jealous.
normalised: So, you’ve finally done it. You've built the perfect e-commerce website. Your product photos are sharper than Ranveer Singh's eyeliner, your descriptions are wittier than a Kapil Sharma punchline, and your prices… well, they’re competitive enough to make your neighbour Sharma uncle jealous.

unnormalised: But wait… why are people adding things to their cart faster than you can say “paneer tikka masala”, only to disappear into the digital ether like a ghost in a Ramsay Brothers film? You, my friend, are experiencing the dreaded cart abandonment!
normalised: But wait… why are people adding things to their cart faster than you can say “paneer tikka masala”, only to disappear into the digital ether like a ghost in a Ramsay Brothers film? You, my friend, are experiencing the dreaded cart abandonment!

unnormalised: Think of it this way: it's like promising your phoolwala uncle you'll buy a whole string of marigolds for Diwali puja, then suddenly remembering you need to catch the 8:15 local from Dadar. Oops! You just abandoned those lovely flowers.
normalised: Think of it this way: it's like promising your phoolwala uncle you'll buy a whole string of marigolds for Diwali puja, then suddenly remembering you need to catch the eight fifteen local from Dadar. Oops! You just abandoned those lovely flowers.

unnormalised: Why does this happen? Maybe your delivery charges are higher than the Everest. Perhaps your checkout process is more confusing than trying to understand the UPSC syllabus. Or maybe, just maybe, aunty next door started gossiping about that amazing sale on sarees and distractions happened.
normalised: Why does this happen? Maybe your delivery charges are higher than the Everest. Perhaps your checkout process is more confusing than trying to understand the U P S C syllabus. Or maybe, just maybe, aunty next door started gossiping about that amazing sale on sarees and distractions happened.

unnormalised: Don't despair! You can win back these wandering shoppers. Try sending a friendly reminder email, "Hey Ramlal! Still thinking about that kurta? We saved it for you!" Offer a small discount like, say, Rs. 50 off, or maybe free shipping within 5 km. Make your checkout simpler than ordering chai at a tapri.
normalised: Don't despair! You can win back these wandering shoppers. Try sending a friendly reminder email, "Hey Ramlal! Still thinking about that kurta? We saved it for you!" Offer a small discount like, say, rupee fifty off, or maybe free shipping within five kilometer. Make your checkout simpler than ordering chai at a tapri.

unnormalised: Remember, converting abandoned carts is easier than convincing your parents you want to be a travel blogger. So, put on your detective hat, figure out the culprit, and watch those sales numbers climb higher than the Qutub Minar. Happy selling, dost!
normalised: Remember, converting abandoned carts is easier than convincing your parents you want to be a travel blogger. So, put on your detective hat, figure out the culprit, and watch those sales numbers climb higher than the Qutub Minar. Happy selling, dost!
